snippet: Last winter, when Lois Capps decisively won a special Congressional election to finish the term of her late husband, Walter, in this swing district on California's central coast, politicians of both parties all but wrote off her Republican opponen...
lead_paragraph: Last winter, when Lois Capps decisively won a special Congressional election to finish the term of her late husband, Walter, in this swing district on California's central coast, politicians of both parties all but wrote off her Republican opponent, Assemblyman Tom Bordonaro, as a hopeless case for this fall. But the ground shifted with President Clinton's August confession of an improper relationship with Monica S. Lewinsky, and this Congressional race suddenly seemed symptomatic of evolving voter sentiment in a volatile election year.
abstract: Local issues remain at forefront of race in California's 22d Congressional District as White House sex scandal ebbs; contest between incumbent Democrat Repr Lois Capps and Republican challenger Assemblyman Tom Bordonaro remains tight in district that is viewed as national bellwether; photo (M)

headline.main: In California Coast Race, the National Scandal Ebbs as the Local Issues Flow
